description: Students study theories and research into human behavior, growth and development. Through lectures, discussions, case studies and field experiences, students analyze the impact of applied psychological principles upon educational institutions and human social behavior. Students also examine the interaction between individual characteristics and needs and political, economic and philosophical issues confronting contemporary American students. Required 20-hour school experience. Prerequisite: Spring Semester sophomore standing. Offered both semesters.
name: Educ Psychology
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Spring Semester sophomore standing. Offered both semesters.
title: Educational Psychology
